The immune response (antiviral antibody) typically appears both in the respiratory secretions and in the blood around 7 days after symptom onset, and is detectable in 90% of patients by 12 days after symptom onset.
17 The presence of antibody inhibits the infectivity of detectable virus. The presence of viral RNA detected by PCR (so-called viral shedding), does not necessarily indicate infectivity, especially in the presence of antiviral antibodies. True infectivity can only be assessed by viral culture in cells in vitro, or be inferred from clinical or epidemiological data.
